intro: Carum bourgaei, commonly known as the mountain caraway, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other caraway species. The plant's structure includes a slender stem, feathery leaves, and a compact inflorescence that produces numerous tiny fruits.
